unit_learning_outcomes.description: Reflect critically on feedback from a range of sources and use this information to improve teaching practice.
Select and organise subject content in logical, sequential and structured ways to address student learning outcomes.
Demonstrate in-depth, broad and coherent knowledge of students' varied backgrounds and abilities and cater for these needs by differentiating the instruction.
Demonstrate detailed content knowledge as well as a research-based understanding of the pedagogies of Economics and Business Studies.
Apply a range of strategies to assess student achievement of learning outcomes and effectively link outcomes and assessment strategies.
Apply of a range of strategies including the use of ICT, classroom discussions, group work and effective use of questioning/listening to foster interest and support learning.
Plan and implement coherent lessons and units of work that are designed to engage students and address learning outcomes.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Completion of readings and online independent learning activities

assessments.description: Stage 6 Topic analysis - Task has three components (1) 1-page concept map showing relationships between central concepts (2) identification of common student misconceptions (3) outline of programming approach and rationale (400 words)

Designing a teaching program - The aim of this task is to create a mini-teaching/learning program that integrates core ideas and showcases innovative and research-based approaches to instruction and assessment (4 rich tasks and a 600-word rationale)
A grade will be awarded based on the quality of work completed in online tasks.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: EDST8231 - Teaching Economics and Business Studies in the Secondary School 2
data.description: The aim of this unit is to develop resilient and reflective teachers of Year 11 and 12 Economics and Business Studies. The unit builds on EDST8230 and concentrates on evidence-based techniques for teaching Economics and Business Studies. The unit also focuses on the collection, development and evaluation of resources, classroom evaluation and reporting.  Work in this unit contributes knowledge and strategies relevant for the in-school teaching experiences in EDST8240 (Professional Practice III and Educational Research).
data.search_title: EDST8231 - Teaching Economics and Business Studies in the Secondary School 2
